episodeTitle: The Ways of Men! Zoro's Techniques, Usopp's Dream
episodeTitleJapanese: 男の生き様！ゾロの業・ウソップの夢
episodeTitleRomanized: Otoko no Ikizama! Zoro no Waza Usoppu no Yume
description: A recap episode featuring flashbacks to Zoro's rescue from Captain Morgan and Usopp's island being saved from Kuro, as the crew reflects on their past adventures and connects them to Robin's current situation. The episode concludes with the comedic 'Report Time' Straw Hat Theater segment.

events.title: Zoro Reflects on Meeting Luffy
events.description: Zoro recalls his rescue from Captain Morgan's execution yard and how Luffy freed him, drawing parallels to Robin's current situation with the World Government.
events.significance: Reinforces the crew's commitment to saving Robin by reminding viewers of how Luffy has always fought against injustice to save his friends.

events.title: Usopp Recalls the Kuro Pirates Incident
events.description: Usopp remembers how Luffy and the crew saved his village from Captain Kuro's plot, emphasizing the crew's dedication to protecting the innocent.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' history of standing up to powerful enemies to save those they care about, reinforcing their resolve to rescue Robin.

events.title: Report Time - Pre-Sanji Eating Habits
events.description: The Straw Hat Theater segment 'Report Time' features a comedic interview with crew members about their terrible eating habits before Sanji joined. Reporter Tsubaki interviews each member in order of joining, revealing humorous stories of Luffy's reckless cooking, Zoro's failed attempts, and Nami's expensive meals.
events.significance: A lighthearted omake that showcases the crew's camaraderie and appreciation for Sanji's cooking skills, providing comic relief during the tense Enies Lobby arc.

quotes.text: I just ate whatever I could catch or find. Sometimes mushrooms grew on the ship!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Describing his terrible eating habits before Sanji

events.title: Tsubaki Fails as a Reporter
events.description: The Report Time segment concludes with reporter Tsubaki being left speechless by Sanji's superior cooking, prompting the crew to declare him a failure as a reporter for having nothing to say.
events.significance: A comedic conclusion to the Straw Hat Theater segment that emphasizes Sanji's exceptional value to the crew.

quotes.text: I just ate whatever I could catch or find. Sometimes mushrooms grew on the ship!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Report Time segment about pre-Sanji eating habits

themes.description: The episode reinforces the crew's unwavering loyalty by paralleling past rescues (Zoro, Usopp's village) with their current mission to save Robin.
themes.symbolism: The flashbacks symbolize that the Straw Hats have always fought against oppressive forces to save those they care about.

themes.description: The Report Time segment provides comedic relief while showcasing the crew's appreciation for Sanji and their journey together.
themes.symbolism: Food represents the bonds between crew members and Sanji's role as both provider and friend.

characterSpotlights.development: The episode revisits Zoro's first encounter with Luffy and his decision to join the crew, highlighting his loyalty and the foundation of their relationship.
keyActions: Recalls being rescued from Morgan's execution yard
Reflects on Luffy's determination to help others

characterSpotlights.development: The episode revisits Usopp's arc with Captain Kuro and how the Straw Hats saved his village, reinforcing his bond with the crew.
keyActions: Recalls the battle against the Kuro Pirates
Remembers how Luffy protected Kaya and the village

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-original filler. The flashback recap content and Report Time segment do not appear in the manga.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode to use 'We Are! (Straw Hat Version)' as the opening theme, featuring the voice actors of the crew members singing.
This is the first episode without an ending theme. The credits appear during the opening theme sequence instead.
Report Time was originally published in The 2nd Log: Sanji on November 30, 2005, and this episode marks its anime adaptation.
Episodes 279-283 are all recap/filler episodes that interrupt the Enies Lobby arc, providing a break in the main storyline.

sources.title: Enies Lobby Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The Report Time segment features a notably different art style with faded coloring and prominent outlines, distinguishing it from the main episode.
Eiichiro Oda created Report Time after his editor gave him three blank pages and told him to draw something for The 2nd Log: Sanji.
